str2: Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Of Hebrew origin; Jacob, the progenitor of the Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (lit: I speak well of) I bless; pass: I am blessed. From a compound of eu and logos; to speak well of, i.e. to bless.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Joseph, a proper name. Of Hebrew origin; Joseph, the name of seven Israelites.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and a probable derivative of kuon; to fawn or crouch to, i.e. prostrate oneself in homage.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The end, extremity. Neuter of an adjective probably akin to the base of akmen; the extremity.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A rod, staff, staff of authority, scepter. From the base of rhapizo; a stick or wand.
